body_html:
1. Train my model using Tensorflow in Python with the custom op using tf.load_op_library(path)
  2. Freeze the graph by modifying the freeze script by adding tf.load_op_library at top
  3. Use the frozen protobuf to perform inferences with Tensorflow C++ API by providing input and output nodes
    Works: Build tensorflow from source with the custom op to generate a single .so file
    Does Not Work: Directly loading the custom op .so with using TF_LoadLibrary
    I am looking for a correct way of using TF_LoadLibrary .

Note: The custom ops are neither input or the output nodes.
body_text:
Train my model using Tensorflow in Python with the custom op using tf.load_op_library(path)
Freeze the graph by modifying the freeze script by adding tf.load_op_library at top
Use the frozen protobuf to perform inferences with Tensorflow C++ API by providing input and output nodes
Works: Build tensorflow from source with the custom op to generate a single .so file
Does Not Work: Directly loading the custom op .so with using TF_LoadLibrary
I am looking for a correct way of using TF_LoadLibrary .

Note: The custom ops are neither input or the output nodes.
body:
1. Train my model using Tensorflow in Python with the custom op using tf.load_op_library(path)
2. Freeze the graph by modifying the freeze script by adding tf.load_op_library at top
3. Use the frozen protobuf to perform inferences with Tensorflow C++ API by providing input and output nodes
Works: Build tensorflow from source with the custom op to generate a single .so file
Does Not Work: Directly loading the custom op .so with using TF_LoadLibrary
I am looking for a correct way of using TF_LoadLibrary .

Note: The custom ops are neither input or the output nodes.
